Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Description: This shabti has a tripartite wig bearing a series of parallel vertical striations, a broad collar, and bracelets on the wrists; it carries two hoes and on its back a basket is represented. The object is made of faded blue faience, with some details, such as the text, painted in black. It bears the name of the scribe Horemheb in a text composed of one axial column and four lines, being a summary of chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead.
